qas.question: What are some dogs prone to?
What are all dogs susceptible to?
Pyometra usually affects what type of female dog?
What are fleas, ticks and mites called?

context: Some breeds of dogs are prone to certain <a0_0>genetic ailments<a0_0/> such as elbow and hip dysplasia, blindness, deafness, pulmonic stenosis, cleft palate, and trick knees. Two serious medical conditions particularly affecting dogs are pyometra, affecting <a2_0><a3_0>unspayed<a2_0/> females<a3_0/> of all types and ages, and bloat, which affects the larger breeds or deep-chested dogs. Both of these are acute conditions, and can kill rapidly. Dogs are also susceptible to <a1_0><a4_0>parasites<a4_0/><a1_0/> such as fleas, ticks, and mites, as well as hookworms, tapeworms, roundworms, and heartworms.
